body:
I managed to solve this issue. It was caused by same includes in both classes. I needed to include a certain module only on the header of the class included. For instance, I had to do the includes only on ConflictGraph.h and not also in ConvexHullBuilder.

Here's how I'm able to access ConflictGraph's different methods from inside ConvexHullBuilder functions

ConvexHullBuilder.h:

private:
   . . .
   ConflictGraph *conflictGraph;

ConvexHullBuilder.cpp:

void ConvexHullBuilder::computeConvexHull(){

  conflictGraph = new ConflictGraph(dcel, params);

  conflictGraph->initializeConflictGraph();
  finalizeConvexHull(parameters);

}

void ConvexHullBuilder::finalizeConvexHull(myType parameters){

  conflictGraph->lookForVisibleFaces(someParams);
}
title: 'Class Instance Object' was not declared in this scope
